dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4312 IH: To enhance the eligibility of India for Foreign Military Sales and exports under the Arms Export Control Act.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Waltz (for himself, Mr. Khanna, Mr. Krishnamoorthi, Mr. Barr, and Mr. Veasey) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To enhance the eligibility of India for Foreign Military Sales and exports under the Arms Export Control Act.

section.header: Eligibility of India for Foreign Military Sales and export status under Arms Export Control Act
section.text: The Arms Export Control Act (22 U.S.C. 2751 et seq.) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in sections 3(d)(2)(B), 3(d)(3)(A)(i), 3(d)(5), 21(e)(2)(A), 36(b)(1), 36(b)(2), 36(b)(6), 36(c)(2)(A), 36(c)(5), 36(d)(2)(A), 62(c)(1), and 63(a)(2), by inserting India, before or New Zealand each place it appears;
in section 3(b)(2), by inserting the Government of India, before or the Government of New Zealand; and
in sections 21(h)(1)(A) and 21(h)(2), by inserting India, before or Israel each place it appears.
